content.rendered:
Don’t you just love beaches? The water, the smooth sand, the great food. There’s nothing quite like the beach – whether you’re there to get active or chill out. There are a lot of things to do in LA, and if you’re a fan of beaches, you’ll certainly have a blast in this city. So, if you’re looking forward to exploring the famous beaches in Los Angeles, or even the quiet beaches, then stick around.

1. Manhattan Beach

Also a well-known suburban neighborhood, Manhattan Beach is a great choice if you’re looking for a relaxing place to chill out after a long day. It’s perfect for soaking up the fresh ocean breeze and taking walks. You can also play your favorite sports here, with beach volleyball being a big pastime for the LA locals.

If you like to watch the sunset, just hop onto the Manhattan Beach Pier. This beach has everything: fun, views, great food, stores, and games. It’s also a very dog-friendly beach, so bring your furry friends along.

2. Venice Beach

This is one of the most famous beaches in LA. Venice Beach is a hotspot for tourists and makes for a fun beach experience. If you’re looking for new things to do in Los Angeles, look no further, because you can swim, surf, go on bike rides and even skate on this beach. Though not as quiet as some other beaches, you’ll be sure to have a great time.

P.S. Don’t miss the amazing sunset views from the Venice Pier!

3. Playa Del Rey Beach

If you’re looking for quiet beaches in LA, then Playa Del Rey will not disappoint. It’s one of LA’s most secluded beaches, which offers its visitors a nice place to sunbathe and take dips in the deep blue ocean water.

This is undoubtedly a great vacation spot and provides a variety of sporting facilities. There are also tons of cafes and stores to check out around the area. Playa Del Rey Beach is indeed a scenic spot, where you can get the peaceful, calming, and quiet time you deserve.

4. Paradise Cove Beach

Paradise Cove Beach is a famous beach in LA, mainly because of the equally popular restaurant with the same name located on the beach grounds. The area provides a sort of romantic and majestic feel, and the view is breathtaking. Movie fans will also appreciate the fact that the beach was a location for popular movies like American Pie 2. The Paradise Cove restaurant is a food haven, serving up delicious dishes to complete the perfect beach experience.

5. Santa Monica State Beach

This beach has been dubbed ‘iconic’ and truer words have never been spoken. This famous beach in LA is a tourist hot spot that is bustling with different people from all walks of life. It allows visitors to enjoy the beautiful weather and views and offers a lot of recreational activities.

The solar-powered Ferris Wheel located on the beach is a real treat, accompanied by roller coasters, multiple game booths, and food stalls. Though not one of the quiet beaches in Los Angeles, Santa Monica State Beach is one of the best beaches in LA. You’ll never get bored of visiting this sandy gem.

6. Hermosa Beach

It’s so fitting that this beach is named ‘hermosa’, which means beautiful. The beach is very clean, with stunning ocean views. The waters are popular for water excursions, and you can engage in sporty outdoor activities such as beach volleyball here.

Hermosa is one of the most famous beaches in LA because of its buzzing bar scene. A jazz club known as The Lighthouse Café is also located on this beach, and there are other restaurants and shops nearby. So, get your beach gear and have the time of your life at the spectacular Hermosa Beach.

7. Cabrillo Beach

Don’t you just love quiet, scenic beaches? One of the most secluded and quiet beaches in LA, Cabrillo Beach is divided into two beaches. Each one provides visitors with a different experience. You can check out amazing attractions like the Cabrillo Marine Aquarium, and engage in popular outdoor activities like surfing, diving, fishing, volleyball, and picnicking. It’s also a great area for sunbathing and basking in the ocean breeze. You’ll have a great time here, as Cabrillo Beach is undoubtedly one of the best beaches in LA.

8. Redondo Beach

If you’re looking for things to do in LA, you’re sure to find some in Redondo Beach. It gives out a cool, touristy vibe and is great for some much-needed family day out. There is also a mouthwatering seafood restaurant, and if you’re feeling generous, you can feed your leftover fries to the (very grateful) seagulls. The pier houses tons of restaurants and shopping options, while providing a fantastic view of the beach. Redondo Beach is a top beach destination and you will have a blast here.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find the best beaches in LA? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
FIND ROOMMATES
